summary: Boy with Luv debuts at #8 on Billboard Hot 100! It's BTS' highest entry so far and also the highest Korean song debut in...
body:
Boy with Luv debuts at #8 on Billboard Hot 100! It’s BTS’ highest entry so far and also the highest Korean song debut in history!!

Make it Right debuts at #95, making BTS the only Korean act to simultaneously chart more than one song on Hot 100 history!

Bubbling under Hot 100

  • #1 HOME
  • #2 Mikrokosmos
  • #11 Dionysus
  • #14 Jamais Vu

World Digital Song Sales

  • Boy with Luv #1
  • Make it Right #2
  • Mikrokosmos #3
  • HOME #4
  • Dionysus #5
  • Jamais Vu #6
  • Intro: Persona #7

Digital sales all kill!!!!!!!!!

This week BTS is the top artist in the US (Artist 100), making it the 3rd time BTS achieves this feat. Also reminder that Map of the Soul:PERSONA debuted at #1 on Billboard!

Congratulations legends 🎉

title: Upside down; Chapter 4
body:
Chapter 3 - Chapter 5

What do you call that feeling when you miss someone? Someone who you fell into a habit with. Someone with who you can talk utter nonsense to and not be judged for it. Like, you can just turn your head to the right and there that person would be, sitting right next to you. Except, you just see an empty space now. Or, maybe you are expecting to hear a voice call out your name instead, you are greeted with a radio silence. And you just desperately want to go back to those moments when you are together with that person, but you can’t?

Namjoon was feeling something like that. It had almost been a week since Yuuri disappeared and his life fell back into the monotonous routine it had been before. Waking up, working, recording, shooting, eating, practicing and going back to sleep. Nothing really changed, other than the gapping hole forming in Namjoon’s heart. Sometimes he finds himself thinking if their friendship or whatever it is between them didn’t mean anything to Yuuri. It had to mean something right? If not, why would she keep coming back in the first place? Or was it just the place? But no, she told him, she hadn’t expected him to come back. Why would she say that? Why didn’t she say anything to him? Why did she disappear without a word?

All sorts of questions burned into his mind making a playground out of it. His anxiety shredding it apart into pieces. He would often go up to the terrace and look out for her even while knowing she’s not going to be up there. He would just sit there, stare up at the sky sometimes and then eventually go back. And just to distract himself, he started working more than he usually does. Hoping it would help keep his thoughts at bay. Or, he would surround himself with the other six. That way, at least, he would be able to forget thinking for those few minutes he would be with them. It doesn’t help all the time, but for most of it, yes.

“You’re acting like a love sick fool”, Jimin commented, his light laughter filling up the room.

Namjoon didn’t say anything. Instead he frowned into his laptop and coiled into himself, in turn knocking off the cup of coffee on his table in the attempt.

“Ugh”, he groaned bending down to pick it up and got up to throw it off into the nearby bin. But before he could, Jimin reached out to him.

“Here, let me do that for you”, He took the empty cup off Namjoon’s hand and handed him a couple of tissues to clear up the spilt coffee.

“Thanks, Jiminie”, Namjoon mumbled and began to clean up.

“Hyung”, He called out, “Do you think she will come back?”

“I don’t think I’d be this miserable if I knew that”, Namjoon sighed and Jimin laughed.

“Do you think she’d come back?” He asked the younger.

“Do you want her to?”

“Desperately”.

“Gosh! You really like her!”

“I think so…”

And just when he thought he was getting used to the void, she came back, with a pop. Like she hadn’t left in the first place. It happened on a Sunday when Namjoon and Taehyung were casually strolling around the company. They could have stayed at their dorms or maybe go out but were too lazy and restless at the sametime. So, they decided to stroll around the company a little. And as they were passing by their studios, they heard a laughter. That unmistakable chime like sound. And Namjoon, even before he could gather his thoughts, his hands reached out to open the door to the room. And it opened with a thud, revealing Yuuri who turned around to look at him, startled by the sound.

His heart lurched into his stomach the moment he saw her. There she was, sitting at a desk, her laptop in front of her and a drawing tablet in her lap. A look of surprise written upon her face. There’s a face on her laptop screen and judging by the earphones plugged into her ears, it appears that she must’ve been on a skype call which Namjoon rudely interrupted. They stared at each other for a moment, both equally shocked. Yuuri then turned around to the screen and whispered something into the microphone and disconnected the call.  

“Oh, hey Namjoon”, She greeted him with a small confused smile.

Namjoon didn’t expect the rush of emotions he felt when he saw her. They were pouring out of him, like a dam that was released, the water rushing out at great velocities per second. And before he could even summarise or process the situation, his feet stepped forward, his arms stretched out, taking her into a tight embrace. Everything stilled around them for a moment. Like a time stop. The sounds in the background seemed to fade away, bit by bit as silence engulfed them and devoured them.

Yuuri stood there, wrapped in Namjoon’s arms, unable to think for a moment. Unable to grasp what was going on. Her heart drumming away in her chest. It was only after she felt Namjoon move his head to bury himself in her shoulder that she picked up enough courage to slowly but hesitantly wrap her arms around his waist. She felt something tug in her chest when Namjoon visibly relaxed in her arms. And that relaxed her a little as well.

“I thought you would never come back”, He whispered, into the hug, his voice almost breaking, “I thought you just disappeared, left and didn’t say anything”.

“I’m sorry…” Yuuri mumbled into his chest, guilt spreading over her as she tried to process the situation. She surely didn’t expect this kind of an outburst. How could she? She never knew how much she meant to him or what a mere sight of her does to him.

They stood there like that for some time. Neither of them moving or pulling away. And then they broke apart giggling awkwardly, both of their faces painted a flaming red.

“I… I’m sorry”, Namjoon apologized, scratching the back of his neck, the embarrassment obvious in his voice, “Didn’t mean to surprise you like that. I – I can explain, I mean…”

“No, no, no, don’t apologize…it’s okay”, Yuuri giggled, a bit embarrassed herself, “Kinda felt nice”.

Namjoon swore his heart stopped for a second or two. Jesus Christ, this girl could be the death of him. Both metaphorically and quite literally.

“And…” She continued, her demeanour a bit hesitant, “I’m sorry I left without saying anything. It kinda happened in a rush and I wasn’t expecting it either. Actually, I wanted to tell you I’d be back but…I didn’t know how, I mean, like, I didn’t know how to contact you or know where your studio was located or where you’d be and before I could even figure it out, I had to leave. I’m sorry”.

Namjoon just watched her in silence. He didn’t know what to say.

“Give me your phone”, He asked after some time. Yuuri perked her head up in surprise, but handed her phone over to him, nonetheless.

He took in his hands, almost dropping it but saving it at the last moment. His hands were still visibly shaking, reflecting how flustered he was from the previous events. He then typed away something and put the phone up to his ear. A moment later his phone began to ring in his pocket, and he disconnected it. Then gave her phone back to her.

“You have my contact now”, He said, “Next time, if anything like this comes up, you know how to reach me”, He paused, contemplating if it’s okay to say what he was going to say next, but then again, he said it anyway, “Just…Don’t disappear on me again, I was really worried something happened”.

The look on Yuuri’s face told him she wasn’t expecting him to miss her or anything like that. She didn’t understand why he would be so worried in the first place. Her mouth opened like she wanted to say something, but for some reason, she decided against it and kept quiet.

A moment of awkward silence passed between them.  

“When did you come back?” Namjoon asked, his voice very quiet.

“Oh…umm…Sometime around the afternoon”, She replied.

“I see. How have you been?”

“Oh, I’ve been okay”, She replied nonchalantly, “What about you?”

“I’ve been okay too”, He shrugged, “Just the same old routine”.

“Ah”.

The conversation ended there. And Namjoon felt a little too awkward to say anything. It was almost like that time she spoke to him for the first time. He was too nervous and kept fidgeting with his hands in his pocket. She was doing something similar too. Her cheeks were flushed a soft pink. She was biting her lip and playing with her fingers. Probably too embarrassed to look at him. It was truly an endearing sight to look at. He just gazed at her, a soft smile spreading over his face.

“What?” She giggled, playfully hitting his arm, her cheeks obviously flushed pink.

“Nothing”, He giggled, his dimples on full display, “I’m just happy you’re back”.

She blushed a deeper shape of pink now.

“Hey”, Namjoon called out to her, suddenly his voice a bit serious.

“Yeah?” She looked up to meet his eyes.

“Mind if I ask you something?” He asked, suddenly a bit apprehensive.

“You can ask me anything”, She replied.

“You…you don’t have to say anything if you don’t want to okay?” He assured her.

“I know”.

“Umm…”, He took a deep breath, “I know, this might sound a little intrusive and like I already said, you don’t have to answer if you don’t want to”.

“Would you mind me asking why you left all of a sudden?”

“Ah” Yuuri smiled a little, “I just went home for a bit. Kinda missed my parents and got a little homesick”. She giggled sheepishly at that.

“I also got to spend some time with my sister. I had fun. But once again, I’m sorry, I left abruptly and didn’t say anything”. She bit her lip while looking at him apologetically.

“Ah”, Namjoon sighed out of relief, “And don’t apologize so much, it’s not really your fault either. I actually thought something went wrong or something. Like my mind jumped off into a fit of overthinking ha-ha”.

“sorry…I made you worry so much”.

Namjoon raised his hand at that, “I’m not taking any more of your apologies”.

“Is that why you were so worried?”

Namjoon looked at her, his gaze questioning.

“I mean due to all your overthinking”

“Well, it’s a part of the reason why I was worried more than I should have. But I would still worry regardless”.

“Why?”

Namjoon looked at her. She wasn’t looking at him anymore, instead she was looking down more at her feet or anything that’s not him.

“Well! You just disappeared with a puff! Almost like you disapparated”, He joked, “But in a serious note tho, I was worried because you are my friend and because I care”.

She finally looked at him. Into his eyes. And he continued.

“We are friends?” She asked incredulously, “I mean, you consider me a friend?”

Namjoon panicked a little here but his gut instinct told him to continue what he was saying.

“I know we don’t know each other that well as of now. But how much ever time we spent together, those meetings on the terrace when we’d just forget everything for however long we’re up there and just relax next to each other, they’ve become a huge part of me. I love being able to spend some time like that, not having to meet expectations or anything and you know, just be myself. You give me that opportunity. I don’t know how you feel about that, but I’ll be damned if I lose someone like you”. And also, because I really like you, but he decided not to say that.

“And, also yes, because I consider you a friend”, he frowned a little here, “Unless…You don’t want to be friends?”

“No, no, no!” Yuuri shook her head, “I mean yes! I love being your friend! I just didn’t know you considered me one”. Then she smiled brightly at him.

Namjoon was confused why she thought he wouldn’t consider her one, but her smile bought a smile on to his face as well and it made him forget to be self-conscious about what he said before. But it also made him feel a lot better. The feeling of being able to communicate at least some of what he felt towards her. What had got him so infatuated with her, even he does not know, but getting to know her, being able to feel at ease with her are somethings that made him like her even more.

“But, thank you…”, She whispered softly, her eyes bright and twinkling, “It means a lot to me and you might not believe it but in the short time we spent, I felt the same towards you too. I’m sorry, I’m bad with communicating feelings but I felt the same too”.

And Namjoon was so glad he told her what he thought and felt. For the smile he got in return was enough to shatter the whole universe.

“Oh, by the way”, Yuuri suddenly perked up, “Wasn’t Taehyung with you before?”

Namjoon’s eyes widened with an awakening, “Shit, Tae, I totally forgot about him!”

She finally looked at him. Into his eyes. And he continued.

“We are friends?” She asked incredulously, “I mean, you consider me a friend?”

Namjoon panicked a little here but his gut instinct told him to continue what he was saying.

“I know we don’t know each other that well as of now. But how much ever time we spent together, those meetings on the terrace when we’d just forget everything for however long we’re up there and just relax next to each other, they’ve become a huge part of me. I love being able to spend some time like that, not having to meet expectations or anything and you know, just be myself. You give me that opportunity. I don’t know how you feel about that, but I’ll be damned if I lose someone like you”. And also, because I really like you, but he decided not to say that.

“And, also yes, because I consider you a friend”, he frowned a little here, “Unless…You don’t want to be friends?”

“No, no, no!” Yuuri shook her head, “I mean yes! I love being your friend! I just didn’t know you considered me one”. Then she smiled brightly at him.

Namjoon was confused why she thought he wouldn’t consider her one, but her smile bought a smile on to his face as well and it made him forget to be self-conscious about what he said before. But it also made him feel a lot better. The feeling of being able to communicate at least some of what he felt towards her. What had got him so infatuated with her, even he does not know, but getting to know her, being able to feel at ease with her are somethings that made him like her even more.

“But, thank you…”, She whispered softly, her eyes bright and twinkling, “It means a lot to me and you might not believe it but in the short time we spent, I felt the same towards you too. I’m sorry, I’m bad with communicating feelings but I felt the same too”.

And Namjoon was so glad he told her what he thought and felt. For the smile he got in return was enough to shatter the whole universe.

“Oh, by the way”, Yuuri suddenly perked up, “Wasn’t Taehyung with you before?”

Namjoon’s eyes widened with an awakening, “Shit, Tae, I totally forgot about him!”

Chapter 3 - Chapter 5

What do you call that feeling when you miss someone? Someone who you fell into a habit with. Someone with who you can talk utter nonsense to and not be judged for it. Like, you can just turn your head to the right and there that person would be, sitting right next to you. Except, you just see an empty space now. Or, maybe you are expecting to hear a voice call out your name instead, you are greeted with a radio silence. And you just desperately want to go back to those moments when you are together with that person, but you can’t?

Namjoon was feeling something like that. It had almost been a week since Yuuri disappeared and his life fell back into the monotonous routine it had been before. Waking up, working, recording, shooting, eating, practicing and going back to sleep. Nothing really changed, other than the gapping hole forming in Namjoon’s heart. Sometimes he finds himself thinking if their friendship or whatever it is between them didn’t mean anything to Yuuri. It had to mean something right? If not, why would she keep coming back in the first place? Or was it just the place? But no, she told him, she hadn’t expected him to come back. Why would she say that? Why didn’t she say anything to him? Why did she disappear without a word?

All sorts of questions burned into his mind making a playground out of it. His anxiety shredding it apart into pieces. He would often go up to the terrace and look out for her even while knowing she’s not going to be up there. He would just sit there, stare up at the sky sometimes and then eventually go back. And just to distract himself, he started working more than he usually does. Hoping it would help keep his thoughts at bay. Or, he would surround himself with the other six. That way, at least, he would be able to forget thinking for those few minutes he would be with them. It doesn’t help all the time, but for most of it, yes.

“You’re acting like a love sick fool”, Jimin commented, his light laughter filling up the room.

Namjoon didn’t say anything. Instead he frowned into his laptop and coiled into himself, in turn knocking off the cup of coffee on his table in the attempt.

“Ugh”, he groaned bending down to pick it up and got up to throw it off into the nearby bin. But before he could, Jimin reached out to him.

“Here, let me do that for you”, He took the empty cup off Namjoon’s hand and handed him a couple of tissues to clear up the spilt coffee.

“Thanks, Jiminie”, Namjoon mumbled and began to clean up.

“Hyung”, He called out, “Do you think she will come back?”

“I don’t think I’d be this miserable if I knew that”, Namjoon sighed and Jimin laughed.

“Do you think she’d come back?” He asked the younger.

“Do you want her to?”

“Desperately”.

“Gosh! You really like her!”

“I think so…”

And just when he thought he was getting used to the void, she came back, with a pop. Like she hadn’t left in the first place. It happened on a Sunday when Namjoon and Taehyung were casually strolling around the company. They could have stayed at their dorms or maybe go out but were too lazy and restless at the sametime. So, they decided to stroll around the company a little. And as they were passing by their studios, they heard a laughter. That unmistakable chime like sound. And Namjoon, even before he could gather his thoughts, his hands reached out to open the door to the room. And it opened with a thud, revealing Yuuri who turned around to look at him, startled by the sound.

His heart lurched into his stomach the moment he saw her. There she was, sitting at a desk, her laptop in front of her and a drawing tablet in her lap. A look of surprise written upon her face. There’s a face on her laptop screen and judging by the earphones plugged into her ears, it appears that she must’ve been on a skype call which Namjoon rudely interrupted. They stared at each other for a moment, both equally shocked. Yuuri then turned around to the screen and whispered something into the microphone and disconnected the call.  

“Oh, hey Namjoon”, She greeted him with a small confused smile.

Namjoon didn’t expect the rush of emotions he felt when he saw her. They were pouring out of him, like a dam that was released, the water rushing out at great velocities per second. And before he could even summarise or process the situation, his feet stepped forward, his arms stretched out, taking her into a tight embrace. Everything stilled around them for a moment. Like a time stop. The sounds in the background seemed to fade away, bit by bit as silence engulfed them and devoured them.

Yuuri stood there, wrapped in Namjoon’s arms, unable to think for a moment. Unable to grasp what was going on. Her heart drumming away in her chest. It was only after she felt Namjoon move his head to bury himself in her shoulder that she picked up enough courage to slowly but hesitantly wrap her arms around his waist. She felt something tug in her chest when Namjoon visibly relaxed in her arms. And that relaxed her a little as well.

“I thought you would never come back”, He whispered, into the hug, his voice almost breaking, “I thought you just disappeared, left and didn’t say anything”.

“I’m sorry…” Yuuri mumbled into his chest, guilt spreading over her as she tried to process the situation. She surely didn’t expect this kind of an outburst. How could she? She never knew how much she meant to him or what a mere sight of her does to him.

They stood there like that for some time. Neither of them moving or pulling away. And then they broke apart giggling awkwardly, both of their faces painted a flaming red.

“I… I’m sorry”, Namjoon apologized, scratching the back of his neck, the embarrassment obvious in his voice, “Didn’t mean to surprise you like that. I – I can explain, I mean…”

“No, no, no, don’t apologize…it’s okay”, Yuuri giggled, a bit embarrassed herself, “Kinda felt nice”.

Namjoon swore his heart stopped for a second or two. Jesus Christ, this girl could be the death of him. Both metaphorically and quite literally.

“And…” She continued, her demeanour a bit hesitant, “I’m sorry I left without saying anything. It kinda happened in a rush and I wasn’t expecting it either. Actually, I wanted to tell you I’d be back but…I didn’t know how, I mean, like, I didn’t know how to contact you or know where your studio was located or where you’d be and before I could even figure it out, I had to leave. I’m sorry”.

Namjoon just watched her in silence. He didn’t know what to say.

“Give me your phone”, He asked after some time. Yuuri perked her head up in surprise, but handed her phone over to him, nonetheless.

He took in his hands, almost dropping it but saving it at the last moment. His hands were still visibly shaking, reflecting how flustered he was from the previous events. He then typed away something and put the phone up to his ear. A moment later his phone began to ring in his pocket, and he disconnected it. Then gave her phone back to her.

“You have my contact now”, He said, “Next time, if anything like this comes up, you know how to reach me”, He paused, contemplating if it’s okay to say what he was going to say next, but then again, he said it anyway, “Just…Don’t disappear on me again, I was really worried something happened”.

The look on Yuuri’s face told him she wasn’t expecting him to miss her or anything like that. She didn’t understand why he would be so worried in the first place. Her mouth opened like she wanted to say something, but for some reason, she decided against it and kept quiet.

A moment of awkward silence passed between them.  

“When did you come back?” Namjoon asked, his voice very quiet.

“Oh…umm…Sometime around the afternoon”, She replied.

“I see. How have you been?”

“Oh, I’ve been okay”, She replied nonchalantly, “What about you?”

“I’ve been okay too”, He shrugged, “Just the same old routine”.

“Ah”.

The conversation ended there. And Namjoon felt a little too awkward to say anything. It was almost like that time she spoke to him for the first time. He was too nervous and kept fidgeting with his hands in his pocket. She was doing something similar too. Her cheeks were flushed a soft pink. She was biting her lip and playing with her fingers. Probably too embarrassed to look at him. It was truly an endearing sight to look at. He just gazed at her, a soft smile spreading over his face.

“What?” She giggled, playfully hitting his arm, her cheeks obviously flushed pink.

“Nothing”, He giggled, his dimples on full display, “I’m just happy you’re back”.

She blushed a deeper shape of pink now.

“Hey”, Namjoon called out to her, suddenly his voice a bit serious.

“Yeah?” She looked up to meet his eyes.

“Mind if I ask you something?” He asked, suddenly a bit apprehensive.

“You can ask me anything”, She replied.

“You…you don’t have to say anything if you don’t want to okay?” He assured her.

“I know”.

“Umm…”, He took a deep breath, “I know, this might sound a little intrusive and like I already said, you don’t have to answer if you don’t want to”.

“Would you mind me asking why you left all of a sudden?”

“Ah” Yuuri smiled a little, “I just went home for a bit. Kinda missed my parents and got a little homesick”. She giggled sheepishly at that.

“I also got to spend some time with my sister. I had fun. But once again, I’m sorry, I left abruptly and didn’t say anything”. She bit her lip while looking at him apologetically.

“Ah”, Namjoon sighed out of relief, “And don’t apologize so much, it’s not really your fault either. I actually thought something went wrong or something. Like my mind jumped off into a fit of overthinking ha-ha”.

“sorry…I made you worry so much”.

Namjoon raised his hand at that, “I’m not taking any more of your apologies”.

“Is that why you were so worried?”

Namjoon looked at her, his gaze questioning.

“I mean due to all your overthinking”

“Well, it’s a part of the reason why I was worried more than I should have. But I would still worry regardless”.

“Why?”

Namjoon looked at her. She wasn’t looking at him anymore, instead she was looking down more at her feet or anything that’s not him.

“Well! You just disappeared with a puff! Almost like you disapparated”, He joked, “But in a serious note tho, I was worried because you are my friend and because I care”.

“We are friends?” She asked incredulously, “I mean, you consider me a friend?”

But how much ever time we spent together, those meetings on the terrace when we’d just forget everything for however long we’re up there and just relax next to each other, they’ve become a huge part of me. “And, also yes, because I consider you a friend”, he frowned a little here, “Unless…You don’t want to be friends?”

“No, no, no!” Yuuri shook her head, “I mean yes! I love being your friend! I just didn’t know you considered me one”. Then she smiled brightly at him.
